definition: to form an image/to call to mind
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Toner, two-component developer, image forming method and apparatus unit.
sentences.chinese: 色粉，雙組分顯影劑，成象方法及成象設備。

sentences.english: A new imaging technology could help automate this.
sentences.chinese: 一種新的成象技術有助於將這個過程自動化。

sentences.english: The quadratic aperture of the cat's-eye diaphragm is imaged too large.
sentences.chinese: 貓眼光欄的方形光孔成象太大。

sentences.english: The work may have applications in improved microscope imaging and light-based therapies.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究的成果可以應用於顯微成象和光學療法。

sentences.english: A practical method for imaging simulation of partially coherent system is introduced in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一種模擬計算部分相干光成象的實用化方法。

definition: to form a picture/to develop a photo/to visualize
the sun and moon/day and month/every day and every month/season/life and livelihood

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
sun, moon and the five visible planets
